SEARCH
Package com.simulation.model

Class ServicePoint

java.lang.Object
com.simulation.model.ServicePoint
public class ServicePoint extends Object
Represents a service point or queue in the simulation system.

A ServicePoint can function in two modes:

  1. Pure Queue: Just holds tasks waiting (e.g., CPU Queue, GPU Queue) - No service time (meanServiceTime = 0) - Tasks are only stored and retrieved
  2. Service Point: Processes tasks with servers (e.g., Data Storage, CPU Compute) - Has service time > 0 - Can have multiple servers (numServers) - Tracks utilization and busy time

ServicePoints support both FIFO queues (LinkedList) and priority queues (PriorityQueue) based on task priority. Thread-safe methods ensure safe concurrent access from simulation thread and UI thread.

Utilization is calculated as: Total Busy Time / (Simulation Time × Number of Servers)

Version:
2.0
Author:
Cloud Simulation Team

  • Constructor Details

    • ServicePoint

      public ServicePoint(String name, int numServers, double meanServiceTime, boolean usePriorityQueue)
      Constructs a new ServicePoint.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the service point
      numServers - the number of servers (for service points) or capacity (for queues)
      meanServiceTime - the mean service time (0 for pure queues)
      usePriorityQueue - true to use priority queue, false for FIFO queue

  • Method Details

    • addToQueue

      public void addToQueue(Task task)
      Adds a task to the queue.

      Thread-safe method that adds task and updates maximum queue length.

      Parameters:
      task - the task to add

    • removeFromQueue

      public Task removeFromQueue()
      Remove task from queue without starting service (for pure queues)

    • isAvailable

      public boolean isAvailable()
      Checks if any servers are available for processing.
      Returns:
      true if at least one server is available, false otherwise

    • isQueueEmpty

      public boolean isQueueEmpty()
      Checks if the queue is empty.
      Returns:
      true if queue is empty, false otherwise

    • startService

      public void startService(double currentTime)
      Starts service by marking a server as busy.

      Used for service points that receive tasks from external queues.

      Parameters:
      currentTime - the current simulation time

    • beginService

      public Task beginService(double currentTime)
      Begins service by taking a task from the queue.

      Removes task from queue and marks a server as busy. Returns null if queue is empty or no servers available.

      Parameters:
      currentTime - the current simulation time
      Returns:
      the task that began service, or null if none available

    • getServiceTime

      public double getServiceTime()
      Generates a random service time from exponential distribution.

      Service time is generated using exponential distribution with the configured mean service time.

      Returns:
      a random service time (always positive)

    • endService

      public void endService(double currentTime)
      Ends service and updates statistics.

      Frees a server and increments tasks served counter. Updates utilization tracking for accurate statistics.

      Parameters:
      currentTime - the current simulation time

    • getUtilization

      public double getUtilization(double currentTime)
      Calculates server utilization based on actual busy time.

      Utilization = Total Busy Time / (Simulation Time × Number of Servers)

      Returns 0 for pure queues or if no servers configured.

      Parameters:
      currentTime - the current simulation time
      Returns:
      utilization value between 0.0 and 1.0 (0% to 100%)
